column1: Kata Robata////The food the second time around was phenomenal. The appetizer and entrée portions were in line with what one would expect for dinner. We ordered a few appetizers
column3: but I have to give a shout out to the agedashi tofu
column5: Kobe beef skewers and tuna with truffles. The Kobe beef was succulent and full of flavor
column6: exactly what one would expect from Kobe beef. The earthy truffles balanced so nicely (and unexpectedly?) with the tuna
column7: who would have thought? And the marinated tuna had a nice tartness to it
column8: perfect to whet one's appetite and as a prelude to entrée. The sashimi and nigiri we had for entrée was fresh and firm
